title: Detroit artist Hocking turns Port Austin barn into boat
text: Detroit artist Hocking turns Port Austin barn into boat The latest piece by celebrated Detroit artist is being unveiled on Saturday. Post to Facebook Detroit artist Hocking turns Port Austin barn into boat The latest piece by celebrated Detroit artist is being unveiled on Saturday. Check out this story on Freep.com: http://on.freep.com/1LTjtv3 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Detroit artist Hocking turns Port Austin barn into boat Detroit Free Press 9:46 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Buy Photo Detroit artist Scott Hocking stands near the front of his latest art piece turning a dilapidated barn into an upside down Ark at a farm in Port Austin on Fri., Oct. 23, 2015. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Fullscreen Buy Photo Detroit artist Steve Coy (right) of Hygienic Dress League and Jim Boyle (left) co-founder of Public Art Pool Space help survey the surrounding area with Detroit artist Scott Hocking. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Buy Photo Detroit artist Scott Hocking nails boards onto a structure from a dilapidated barn. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Detroit artist Scott Hocking works on attaching boards while finishing his latest art piece turning a dilapidated barn into an upside down Ark at a farm in Port Austin. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Detroit artist Scott Hocking (center) shares a laugh with Hygienic Dress League artists Dorota Coy and Steve Coy as they stand with their child Luca Coy and their dog Theo as Hocking works on finishing his latest art piece. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Buy Photo Detroit artist Scott Hocking works on attaching boards while finishing his latest art piece. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Artist Steve Coy (left) of Hygienic Dress League, checks out the space as Jim Boyle, co-founder of Public Art Pool Space, helps hand boards to Detroit artist Scott Hocking as he works on finishing his latest art piece. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Jim Boyle, co-founder of Public Art Pool Space, helps hand boards to Detroit artist Scott Hocking as he works on finishing his latest art piece turning a dilapidated barn into an upside down Ark at a farm in Port Austin on Friday October 23, 2015. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Detroit artist Scott Hocking works on attaching boards while finishing his latest art piece turning a dilapidated barn into an upside down Ark at a farm in Port Austin on Friday October 23, 2015. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Fullscreen Buy Photo Detroit artist Scott Hocking is seen behind boards from a dilapidated barn he used while finishing his latest art piece turning a dilapidated barn into an ark at a farm in Port Austin. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Detroit artist Scott Hocking works on finishing his latest art piece turning a dilapidated barn into an ark at a farm in Port Austin on Friday October 23, 2015. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Fullscreen Buy Photo Detroit artist Steve Coy (left) of Hygienic Dress League and Jim Boyle (right) co-founder of Public Art Pool Space help survey the surrounding area with Detroit artist Scott Hocking. Ryan Garza, Detroit Free Press Buy Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Detroit artist Scott Hocking's latest art piece, turning a dilapidated barn into an ark, is seen at a farm in Port Austin on Friday October 23, 2015.
